Physiological/Pathological: Both – normal islet function (insulin secretion) or diabetic-like dysfunction (if cells are from diseased donors)
Cell Source: Primary human islet cells or stem-cell-derived beta cells, aggregated into uniform spheroids
Multiple Cell Types: Yes, if islets contain alpha, beta, delta cells (native islet composition)
Stromal Cells: Not typical for islets, but possible if co-cultured
Tissue-resident Immune: Only if included from donor tissue; generally islets have minimal resident immune
Circulating Immune: No, plate is static; no perfusion of immune cells (unless added in co-culture)
Crosstalk (Multi-tissue): No, each well is isolated. Multi-tissue crosstalk not in one plate
Extracellular Matrix: Cells produce own ECM, no external scaffold in standard protocol
3D Scaffold: Spheroid-based, no artificial scaffold; self-assembly in microwells
Notable Features: Uniform islet-like spheroids with stable glucose-responsive insulin secretion, useful for diabetes research/transplant
Plate/Format (Throughput): Sphericalplate 5D in 6-, 24-, or 96-well format; high number of microwells per well
Max Culture Duration: Days to weeks with regular media exchange
Readouts - Live Imaging: Yes, clear plastic bottom for spheroid imaging in microwells
Readouts - Supernatant Sampling: Yes, medium from each well (pooled secretions from many spheroids)
Readouts - Cell Retrieval: Yes, pipette spheroids out for endpoint analysis or single-cell dissociation
Readouts - Whole Tissue: Yes, entire spheroid can be fixed for histology or IHC
Readouts - MEA: No integrated arrays, static culture only
Readouts - Integrated Biosensors: No, external assays (ELISA for insulin, etc.)
Dead Volume: Standard multiwell plate volumes, minimal leftover media in microwells
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Limited to media exchange; no dynamic flow
model_availability: Product only (SP5D plates). Users supply cells/assays

Cell Source: Cancer cell lines or patient tumor cells ± fibroblasts, optional immune cells
Multiple Cell Types: Yes, e.g. tumor + fibroblasts, or tumor + immune cells
Stromal Cells: Yes, cancer-associated fibroblasts can be co-seeded
Tissue-resident Immune: Possible if included from tumor sample
Circulating Immune: Not under flow. Could add immune cells in co-culture, but static
Crosstalk (Multi-tissue): No. Each well is just spheroids of a single tumor type unless manually combining
Extracellular Matrix: Cells secrete their own ECM, no external scaffold needed
3D Scaffold: No artificial scaffold; aggregates form spontaneously in microwells
Notable Features: Uniform size tumor spheroids for drug screening; quick formation & easy high-content imaging
Plate/Format (Throughput): 6-, 24-, or 96-well Sphericalplate 5D. Each well has hundreds of microwells (medium–high throughput)
Max Culture Duration: Days to weeks, depends on tumor cell viability/proliferation
Readouts - Live Imaging: Yes, can do brightfield or fluorescence in microwells
Readouts - Supernatant Sampling: Yes, media can be assayed for secreted factors
Readouts - Cell Retrieval: Yes, spheroids can be pipetted out, then dissociated
Readouts - Whole Tissue: Yes, fix entire spheroid for histology/IF
Dead Volume: Standard multiwell format; minimal leftover media
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Limited to manual media changes or compound additions
model_availability: Product only (SP5D plate). End-user assembles tumor spheroids

Organs/Tissues: Pluripotent stem cell aggregates (early embryoid bodies), can differentiate into multiple lineages
Physiological/Pathological: Mostly physiological differentiation, or modeling genetic disease iPSCs for pathological studies
Cell Source: Human iPSCs (patient-derived or healthy) self-aggregated into uniform EBs
Multiple Cell Types: Yes, as EBs spontaneously differentiate into multiple lineages
Stromal Cells: Not by default; can be introduced if co-differentiation is desired
Tissue-resident Immune: No, unless specifically introduced in co-culture
Crosstalk (Multi-tissue): No. Each well forms iPSC EBs; no linking to other tissues
Extracellular Matrix: Cells secrete their matrix during differentiation, no external scaffold needed
3D Scaffold: No external scaffold, purely cell self-assembly in microwells
Notable Features: High yield of uniform embryoid bodies for directed differentiation protocols
Plate/Format (Throughput): Sphericalplate 5D in multi-well format (6, 24, 96). Thousands of EBs in one plate
Max Culture Duration: Days–weeks for differentiation steps with media changes
Readouts - Live Imaging: Yes, brightfield or fluorescence imaging of EBs in wells
Readouts - Supernatant Sampling: Yes, can measure secreted factors (e.g. growth factors)
Readouts - Cell Retrieval: Yes, pick spheroids and dissociate for flow cytometry or transcriptomics
Readouts - Whole Tissue: Yes, entire EB for immunostaining or sectioning
Perfused: No, static culture with manual media changes
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Limited to media changes or addition of differentiation factors
model_availability: Product only (SP5D plate). R&D labs do their own iPSC protocols
